Viehscheid Bad Hindelang / Radtour zur Käseralpe

Posted on 18 September 2011 by Andy

Schon ein wenig her, aber ich kam erst jetzt dazu das Video zu schneiden. Diesmal Viehscheid und Frühschoppen in Bad Hindelang. Beschwingt ging es danach mit Fahrrad auf die Käseralpe.

Das letzte Drittel hatte dann doch wieder ordentliche Steigungen von bis zu 20%. Aber irgendwie kommt man immer rauf, mit dem richtigen Ziel vor Augen: .

 


2011-09-10 09:13 - Viehscheid/Käseralm auf einer größeren Karte anzeigen

Gesamtentfernung: 67,68 km (42,1 mi)
Zeit in Bewegung: 4:21:02
Durchschnittsgeschw.: 7,43 km/h (4,6 mi/h)
Durchschnitt in Bew.: 15,56 km/h (9,7 mi/h)
Max. Geschwindigkeit: 49,79 km/h (30,9 mi/h)
Niedrigste Höhenlage: 790 m (2591 Fuß)
Höchste Höhenlage: 1450 m (4757 Fuß)
Höhengewinn: 1591 m (5220 Fuß)
Maximale Steigung: 21 %
Minimale Steigung: -18 %
Aufgezeichnet am: Sa. Sep 10 09:13:10 MESZ 2011

EMF: Object is not contained in a resource

Posted on 17 September 2011 by Andy

I had a small problem saving my EMF model to XML. I got the error message “The object … is not contained in a resource”.

The solution is simple. In the EMF editor just set containment to true for the reference:

Done! After that, the object was saved correctly in the XML file.

Weiterlesen / Read more


Tagged: EMF, Problem, Recource, and Save by Andy

setAccelerator(SWT.CTRL | 'O'); //not working!

Posted on 16 September 2011 by Andy

In my current RCP application I had a problem that the menu key shortcuts did not work correctly:

When I started the application and pressed the shortcut, nothing happened. After I opened the menu once, suddenly everything worked!

I created the menu item in the “ApplicationActionBarAdvisor”:

actionOpen.setAccelerator(SWT.CTRL ‘O’);

So what is the problem? It came up, that in an RCP application the menu and the items are loaded, when the user opens it for the first time. There is not really a solution for that, just a workaround: I had to call “updateAll(true)” on the menu manager:

IWorkbenchWindow window = Workbench.getInstance().getActiveWorkbenchWindow();

if(window instanceof WorkbenchWindow) {
    MenuManager menuManager = ((WorkbenchWindow)window).getMenuManager();
    menuManager.updateAll(true);
}

I called this from my main application window. After that the key bindings worked correctly.

Weiterlesen / Read more


Tagged: binding, Key, menu, Problem, and RCP by Andy
